Bio

I'm currently a second-year Ph.D. student in the Urban Infrastructure Lab at the Urban Design & Planning Interdisciplinary Ph.D. Program at the University of Washington. I am fortunate to be advised by Dr. Jan Whittington and Dr. Qing Shen. Check my CV here.

I am interested in physical, cultural, and institutional spaces within city boundaries and my current research interests are in the ethical discussions about AI applications in urban planning, especially in the era of climate change. I'm doing theoretical and empirical work on energy, infrastructure planning, climate impact, and artificial intelligence as well as developing tools to assist cities in making climate-related decisions.

My master's and doctoral coursework plans are a combination of urban planning, public policy, and data science resources at the University of Washington. Please check my full coursework list here to get some inspirations. Also, you can refer to the programs and courses recommended by the Urban Infrastructure Lab. Hope this information is helpful to you.

News

  • [05/18/23] Attended Spatial Social Network Workshop at Georgia Tech.

  • [09/28/22] Started the PhD in Urban Design and Planning at the University of Washington.
  • [06/18/22] Graduated from Master of Urban Planning Program at the University of Washington.
  • [10/15/21] Attended ACSP 2021 with Prof. Christine Bae on Effects of Zoning and Land Use Policies on Land Value and Densification in the City of Seattle.
